subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Modern Project Management - Managing the Start-up, Scheduling and Budgeting
headline: Improve your project management skills by learning how to start, schedule, and budget for a new project.
description: This free online startup project management course will give you the tools required to get projects completed on time and within budget. Professional project managers produce complex and difficult products with a series of project management techniques, such as: Managing project startup, creating and manage project schedules, and estimating and managing project costs. This free course will help you advance your project management abilities.
courseDescription:
This course will begin by discussing the steps to be undertaken when starting a project. You will study the project selection process, the project scope evaluation, the project start-up phase, the alignment process, and the communications planning procedure. You will learn the difference between an organization’s mission, goals, and objectives as well as study the uses of a scope document and how scope is affected by project complexity. The course will also discuss the purpose of the alignment process and the effect lack of trust can have on a project.

You will then study project time management and learn about schedules, the elements of time management, and the critical path and float. You will learn the best way to manage schedules and how to use project scheduling software to do so. The course will then discuss the strategies and means of estimating and managing project costs in modern project management, teach you the work breakdown structure and how it relates to activities, and teach you how to use graphic representations for time management.

This Modern Project Management - Managing the Project Start-up, Scheduling and Budgeting course is the third in a series that teaches contemporary project management. The task of an effective project manager is to oversee the planning and execution of a project. They make sure that the project's overall goals and milestones are all aligned with the organization's strategy. By the end of this course, you will be much more able to achieve these goals through effective project scheduling and budgeting. So why wait? Start gaining these critical skills, today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

    • Describe how the missions are different depending on the type of organization.
    • Define economic terms used for choosing projects.

    • Describe the influences of funding, timing, and unofficial considerations on project selection.
